page.title: 14BUTTERFLY COUNT
page.content: AT HANSLOPE SCHOOL, SWEET CHESTNUT CLASS HAVE DONE A BUTTERFLY COUNT. WE LOOKED FOR BUTTERFLIES IN GARDENS, ALLOTENTS AND FIELDS. OUR FIRST BUTTERFLY COUNT WAS ON FIFTH JUNE AND THE WEATHER WAS CLOUDY AND DAMP.OUR SECOND COUNT WAS NINETEENTH JUNE AND IT WAS SUNNY AND WARM.THE THIRD COUNT WAS THE TENTH JULY AND IT WAS HOT AND SUNNY. THE BUTTERFLIES WE SAW MOST OF WERE SMALL AND LARGE WHITES SIXTY TWO ALLTOGETHER MOSTLY ON ALLOTMENTS BECAUSE THEY LIKE TO EAT THE CABBAGES AND VEGATABLES.WE SAW TWEWNTY SEVEN WALL BROWNS, NINE MEADOW BROWNS, TWO PEACOCKS AND ONE RED ADMIRAL. WE SAW MOST BUTTERFLIES ON TENTH JULY BECAUSE IT WAS HOTTER THAN THE OTHER DAYS AND MORE FLOWERS HAD GROWN SINCE THE FIRST COUNT.
